surveytidy 0.1.0

Remove rows containing missing values from a survey design object

Source: R/07-tidyr.R
drop_na.survey_base.Rd

Physically removes rows where the specified columns contain NA. If no columns are specified, any NA in any column triggers removal. Always issues surveycore_warning_physical_subset. Errors if all rows would be removed.

Prefer dplyr::filter() with !is.na(col) for subpopulation analyses — it keeps all rows and gives correct variance estimates.

Usage

# S3 method for class 'survey_base'
drop_na(data, ...)

Arguments

data

A survey design object.

...

<tidy-select> Columns to inspect for NA. If empty, all columns are checked.

Value

The survey object with rows containing NA in the selected columns removed.

See also

dplyr::filter() for domain-aware row marking (preferred)

Other row operations: arrange.survey_base()

Examples

library(tidyr)
df <- data.frame(y = c(rnorm(99), NA), wt = runif(100, 1, 5))
d  <- surveycore::as_survey(df, weights = wt)

# Remove rows with NA in y
d2 <- suppressWarnings(drop_na(d, y))
nrow(d2@data)  # 99
#> [1] 100
